website_summaries.verdict: This attractive, easy-to-use gate is the best of the best. We wish the latch were up to par with the rest of the solid construction, but that's our only complaint.
pros: Pressure-fit installation for doorways and hardware for stairways paired with easy operation make this a great gate for openings up to 48 inches
cons: Durable metal gate, but the opening latch is plastic and feels a bit flimsy

website_summaries.verdict: This popular gate exudes elegance with its arched center and attractive bronze finish. However, correct pressure mounting can be a bit of a headache.
pros: Opens both ways, but can be adjusted to open inwards for added safety at the top of a staircase
Stunning design doesn’t detract from home decor
cons: Installation can be frustrating and time consuming
Secure pressure mounting seems to compromise upper latch alignment

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for puppies and babies!!
customer_reviews.text: This great works great. I bought this gate knowing that soon I will be having a child but it works great as a dog gate as well. It is fairly easy to set up with the different extensions that are included. The best way to install is to find the extensions that work best then put in the fasteners. The metal is very strong and sturdy. I definitely recommend this product if you have baby or a puppy. I will probably purchase another one when we have a child to prevent them from entering certain spaces. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Davis

customer_reviews.title: Broke immediately
customer_reviews.text: Door seemed sturdy, but there is a small rivet that holds the lower part of the door into the hinge. Broke instantly and now the door basically comes completely out of the frame each time you life to open it. Just finished installing new gate, now I'm going to have to go through the process of returning this large awkward package.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good looking gate but not for us
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this gate but it did not work for us. The mechanism to open the gate is hard. My husband and I weren't able to open it with one hand and without using the extra effort. When the gate would close the bottom latch wouldn't close properly either. We adjusted it a few times with no luck. Good looking gate but was not happy with the function. Wondering if we had a defect gate? Didn't want to play the waiting game as we needed a gate ASAP. Ended up getting another Regalo walk through gate. Much easier to open and close.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, and great looking gate!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this gate!!! I purchased this gate for my deck, to keep my great dane puppy from coming up on the deck, and ripping my grill covers to shreds!!! I initially had a accordion style closet door screwed to the deck! This gate looks sooo much better, and makes it very easy to go up and down the steps!!! No more climbing over!!!
customer_reviews.author: Al Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Latch gets stuck, had to tape it to open the gate.
customer_reviews.text: It works, I guess. When we closed it, the bottom latch got stuck and we could not open it anymore. I had to ply it open with a screwdriver. I taped the bottom latch it to be able to use the gate. It closes, but could easily be pushed open, offering little protection. Now it does not work properly. I reached out to customer service and never received an email back. Waited a week, finally decided to live chat them and it took forever to get an agent. The representative just gave me a number and told me to open a warranty claim. Very irritating.
customer_reviews.author: 🍓 Me o w 🖤

customer_reviews.title: Truly truly truly disappointed after spending so much money.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot get it to square up. The top latch is at least 1 1/2 inches away from locking position. Cannot put enough tension to move the latch on top anywhere close enough to lock. Holes screwed in our wooden rail and mollies in the wall. Brackets stuck on with heavy duty stickers..... Out to the trash it goes....Arrived is a retaped and damaged box so may have been bad when we received it. Too much pieces to put back in box and return. Expensive waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: MKB

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this! It’s awful!
customer_reviews.text: Worst purchase ever! Awful for stairs! You have to step over the bottom piece, with an infant or toddler in your arms, that’s asking for a tripping accident! It doesn’t latch well! It’s an over piece of crap! If my husband had t thrown the box away, I would have sent back! Now I’m out all of this money and I can’t sell it to someone because who would want this?! I’m very upset with the shoddiness! We can’t even get the gate to lock in place the bottom catches like it’s supposed to but the top doesn’t lock! Ugh!! Just a total disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: Hope D.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my dog enclosed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because we have an outdoor courtyard area that leads to the front yard and then to a busy street. I was worried about my dog shooting out the front door and into the street but didn't want the expense or the permanency of installing a wrought iron gate leading out of the courtyard. This has been out there for over 6 months and it works great. A little difficult to open as you really have to lift the gate up, but it's perfect for keeping our little guy safe from the busy road and has held up well outside in the weather. Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Working mom

customer_reviews.title: Poor design and customer service
customer_reviews.text: Positives: Sturdy material and able to extend to fill a large entryway Negatives: The gate came with a gap of about 3 inches between the movable gate and the stationary closure point. There is absolutely no way that the gate could ever securely close with this design, which appears to be either a straight up design flaw or production defect. Unfortunately on top of this, customer service is lacking to get help to resolve the issue. I contacted customer service for Summer almost 1 week ago alerting them to the issue and asking for help resolving (new part or exchange) and have received no response.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Attractive Dog Gate!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent entryway dog gate! The extra tall structure prevents dogs jumping over. The metal sturdiness also withstands my beagles leaning on gate without need of being screwed into wall, but has the option for more support. My photo is gate in a 47.5 inch width area.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Works great for a stairs with some modification
customer_reviews.text: The gate works well but since our stair case was wide, the installed gate was to not as rigid as I expected it to be once the extensions pieces were installed. The kids would just push and pull on it until it bowed out and popped open. I modified the gate by purchasing 90 degree angle metal from Home Depot and cut 4 pieces at 10 inches long and secured it with self tapping screws. The metal reinforced the gate and made it super rigid. Now the kids can’t open it, mission accomplished.
customer_reviews.author: GJOLZ

customer_reviews.title: Elegant, stylish and sturdy design
customer_reviews.text: We’ve been looking for a dog gate for a while that will fit our needs for our mini goldendoodle (1year old). The product came in a box within a box, so I think that provided some protection during transport/delivery. Finally, we found a design that looks elegant and solidly built at the same time. It’s a seamless install as long as we read and followed the entire instructions. Our mistakes were mainly user errors LOL. This can only work if installed against a flat wall, NO baseboard, since it has to be flat against the floor. It’s very sturdy even with adult weight and the material is heavy. We are very happy with this brand and we highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Fashionista96

customer_reviews.title: The “sigh of relief” gate
customer_reviews.text: We needed to blend two families with three dogs and four children into one household for six weeks (during the Coronavirus lockdown!). We tried a few things, including a different kind of gate. This one did the trick! Tall enough the dogs couldn’t jump over it. Easy enough to operate the 8 and 6 year old could do it. Sturdy enough to withstand the toddlers yanking on it without it budging. This gate brought a sigh of relief to the situation.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: just what i expected
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my first one, took a little time putting it up, but I did it, it's a just balancing and tightening. I have Golden Retriever puppy and wanted to keep her out of living area which has multiple doorways. I have ended up purchasing 3 gates and they are working out great. She's 17 wks old and weighs in 38 lbs. Her jumping has not taken the gate down. We soon hope to have jumping under control. But in the mean time we know she is safe behind these walk thru gates. Gates not only work, sturdy, they are attractive.
customer_reviews.author: Jeri Miklos

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but tricky
customer_reviews.text: This gate is very solidly built overall, although the locking mechanism is a bit flimsy. The plastic locking lever doesn't give confidence in longevity. The lock is also very difficult for elderly to figure out. The two-part motion of unlocking (pull and lift) is very unintuitive. I understand this is to keep exploring kids at bay. However, neither my parents or my sister could figure it out. Since we are only using it to keep a dog out of the kitchen, I ended up taping one of the locking mechanisms open, so we only need to use the most intuitive part of it. With the tape in place, there's no more need for lifting. Anyway, we're still keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: mitoboru

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: I saw another review here that said it wasn't good to use if you used the full available width -- I did not find that to be true. If you're expanding it the full amount, just be sure to put one extension on either side of the main piece, rather than putting two extensions on one side. This will help balance the load. Works great for my new crawler -- it's sturdier than others I've purchased, especially for a pressure-mount.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Not threaded or wrong bolt sizes
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this product. While it has a nice appearance the bolts that tighten/wedge the gate are either the wrong size or the holes they screw into are not threaded. I have reversed and flipped each section to make sure I had it configured right without success. Which brings me to the second issue, the manual makes references to numbers in the given diagrams but the diagrams are labeled with letters. Normally not an issue as something like that is easily figured out but it speaks to the lack of attention to detail. I plan on returning this item.
customer_reviews.author: BookCritic

customer_reviews.title: Color is not bronze, more of an Army Green Truck Color
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed with the color. This must be the "new" bronze. I was hoping for the "old" bronze color. I can usually get use to about anything, but every time I look at the gate, I think of an Army Jeep color. The other thing I wish that vendors would put into their description is how wide the gate opening is. Trying to carry something through this gate is a challenge. It is a narrow opening. The gate itself is good looking. As far as easy to install, I haven't a clue. My husband did it and he never has a problem with installation of stuff.
customer_reviews.author: 88forever

customer_reviews.title: Used for outside deck
customer_reviews.text: Really needed to find a gate that would keep my littlest from getting access to concreted front porch with steps. I have this open deck the leads the my front porch. The space was 52 inches wide and the gate secured itself snug, very easy install. Please keep in mind placing the individual spacers accordingly that will fit straight and tight the your space. We found the when we paired all the sections on one side, the gate was weak and didn't latch correctly. So keep that in mind when installing in your home.
customer_reviews.author: Adelina

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for baby-proofing
customer_reviews.text: We love the look and color of this door. I tried a couple others that didn't have the same flexibility required to fit the opening of doorway I was needing to fill. I stumbled across this and in color, style & size it was a perfect fit for us. It's easy to open if you know how, but secure enough that I have zero concerns about a child too small for the stairs getting past it. If you're looking for baby gates there are a lot of options. Trust the research I've done and the experience I've had with this and others over the years, and buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Smith

customer_reviews.title: Best Purchase Alert!!
customer_reviews.text: My two year olds room is the closest to the stairs. Putting this gate in her door was one of the best things I could have done. It took multiple tries for her 17yo sister to figure out how to open it. She’s pushed against it but the gate was sturdy enough not to budge. We usually leave the gate open during the day so that she is freely able to go in and out to our rooms and go downstairs but close it at night to make sure she’s not midnight snack hunting while we are sleeping. I would most definitely recommend this gate, just like it was recommended to me.
customer_reviews.author: CauseImALady

customer_reviews.title: would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these to keep my husky out of the kitchen and they are far better quality than the gates we did have up. They are heavy and very strong. The height is perfect! They are slightly stiff opening and closing but it's getting better the more they are used. The color is not what I would call bronze, it's more of almost a brown greenish color but still very pretty.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Barras

customer_reviews.title: A reliable, well-made, easily installed gate.
customer_reviews.text: The arrival of our 2 month old Aussie puppy forced some changes in the household. His safe area was the kitchen. We installed the gate in the doorway entrance to the kitchen. In the past, with other dogs, we had used accordion style gates and plastic expanding gates with limited success. The former were flimsy and short, the latter required two hands to operate and reposition. Seven months have passed, our pup is now ready for the rest of the house. The gate has done its work and is still in perfect condition. It's so nice when a product exceeds one's expectations.
customer_reviews.author: ReviewKing

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and functional for pet owners
customer_reviews.text: We have a number of cats and dogs in our family, and we sometimes foster animals - so we need to keep some animals separated at different times. If all you do is read the installation guide, it seems complex - I'd recommend the company improve the installation guide - quick, easy work from a professional technical communicator to make a lot more clear. If you watch the company-provided online video (well-made), you'll understand the basics of it, and be able to install without a problem. Caveat: So far, we've only needed the basic gate and haven't used the extensions and haven't needed for a staircase.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah H. Silvi

customer_reviews.title: Baby safety
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for our crawling infant. He uses the bars to practice standing up *eye roll* so he has slammed his face on it a few times already. For this reason I wished they came padded already. It is very sturdy and uses tension to stay in place. The directions are not great about addressing the gap in the gate. It is there intentionally. Only when you get the right tension will it line up & click in place properly so be mindful of that. It is not a defect. Our doorway was only 30in and this fit it perfectly with no extensions.
customer_reviews.author: Ilesina

customer_reviews.title: Beware of Manufacturing Problems
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this gate to keep me dogs out of the back of the house. The first one arrived and was defective. Looked like a manufacturing problem where the gate and the latch were supposed to meet was a huge gap. There was no way to bring the 2 together to make it work so I ordered a replacement thinking it was a one time manufacturing error. The replacement arrived and lo and behold had the exact same problem. There was no way this gate was going to latch with a 3 inch gap at the top of the gate. Not worth the time or effort to try this again. Beware of the manufacturing problems with this gate
customer_reviews.author: TxJewelya

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this for a week and love it. Our 85 lbs dog can knock it over, so it very sturdy. Fits perfectly in all of our hallways and stairwells. It was very easy to install. The color in the picture looked more tan/cream. After receiving it’s a nice white color that works well with white trim
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks great!
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, wish I’d bought it sooner. Was simple enough to set up but a little tricky to get tightly into place bc the latch where the gate opens and closes would get too tight (wouldn’t open) if we put what seemed like the necessary tension on either side. So ultimately we had to loosen the tension, making the gate a little less secure. As long we we don’t lean on it, I think it remain secure, so I’m happy enough with it. Definitely looks WAY better than the wooden baby gate we had been using that was always coming apart or loosening.
customer_reviews.author: mcsc

customer_reviews.title: Gate Bowed Soon After Installation - Not Sturdy Enough
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this gate to span a large gap between two walls into our kitchen. It didn't quite fit so we ordered some separate wall protectors that added a couple of inches. Installation was fine and it worked well for a couple of days. However, as shown in the attached pictures, it soon bowed under the pressure of being installed at or near it's maximum width. Now it doesn't close and latch unless physically forced back into place. I saw a previous review that showed this issue and should have listened. We'll be returning this gate and looking for something similar that is sturdy enough to not fail within days.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: We needed something to separate the hallway leading to the bathroom and kitchen from the baby's room and living room where we let our daughter play. I give this a solid 'Meh' because it looks nice and is sturdy enough for a six-month-old. The problem is that we wanted to put the extensions all on one side due to the doorway layout and it seemed to bow out a lot from the tension before it was tight enough to stay closed. (The gate portion is made so that when you hit the correct tension the latch lines up, it starts out with a bit of a gap.) Not sure I would trust it at the top of a staircase.
customer_reviews.author: Alissa V

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't get the gate to open once installed
customer_reviews.text: The gate looked great and seemed sturdy, I was excited to see it in action. Well, from there it went downhill. Once installed it was unable to be opened. The top and bottom did not line up and so while the top would open the bottom was stuck closed with the pin. Terrible. It is either bent or defective. My hubby was annoyed after trying for an hour to get it to work correctly. I was extremely disappointed since I did my due diligence checking reviews and thinking I bought a good gate. Horrible and I would not recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: BEST CHOICE FOR A STURDY, WELL BUILT WALK-THRU BABY GATE
customer_reviews.text: SUMMER INFANT WALK-THRU BABY GATE - We chose this gate to separate room areas for the dogs and made the selection based on the flexibility for widths, and design. The gate is very well designed and fabrication/finish quality is also very good. Packaging is excellent and eliminates damage and scratches to the finish. We were so impressed with how well the first one worked, we immediately ordered a second one for our other opening. Our widest opening is just under 48 inches, so this gate is perfect with the two extension pieces. None of the competing gates had this feature. We've had them installed about two months and have zero complaints. Great product, works as described.
customer_reviews.author: Ron N

customer_reviews.title: Keeps our 70lb German Shepherd puppy contained!
customer_reviews.text: This gate has been a life saver. It is difficult enough that a toddler can't open it, but easy enough for an adult to open with one hand. We haven't had it fall over once. We've had it in two different size door frames, one where we needed to use one of the extenders, and one that uses no extenders. Neither have had issues and it's always been very stable, even with a large energetic dog jumping up on it. Looks nice, and high enough to keep our dog from wanting to jump over it, she has successfully once but it was difficult for her, she hasn't tried it again.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great high-quality gate. We have a large opening to another room that needed blocking off from our puppy. The opening has molding around it so it's not in contact with the sheetrock. We didn't have to install anything on the walls to use this. It was simple to install and works great for our little Pug. If you have a gigantic dog that wants to try to push through you might need to install the included hardware on the wall to keep it in place. this is also a nice tall height. We're very happy with this gate.
customer_reviews.author: Bellaflora

customer_reviews.title: Worth it...
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these hoping they would be as expected... and they are! Just got a German Shepherd puppy and need to keep her in and out of certain areas. Tall enough that she can’t get over them. Sturdy enough over long gap... but be sure to carefully follow instructions! My longer gate was a difficult install because of a bad contractor who had no idea what “square” means. So I had to level the gate. After that, works perfectly. Bottom lock does occasionally require a light push with foot to set. Satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Drummerman951

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful well thought out gate!
customer_reviews.text: All positive comments, NO negatives!!!!! I have WIDE doorways in the master bedroom and to the master bathroom. I figured out a simple trick to make installation SUPER EASY! I used on of my new HD loading straps and watched the belt to align both sides so the door was aligned perfectly. EASY PEASY! Product seems to be built very strong. I TOTALLY RECOMMEND BUYING THIS GATE PROJECT FOR ANYONE NEEDING TO SEGREGATE YOU FUR BABIES! I LOVE OUR GATE AND THE EASE OF INSTALLING WITH MY RATCHET STRAP!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts, had to send back
customer_reviews.text: Very solid and SUPER heavy, not cheap material. That's the good news, (and why I gave it two stars instead of one). Bad is that it requires more assembly than I prefer, especially after I had gone through all the work of carrying it across the building, struggling it out of the shipping box and then the product, cut all the cardboard and tags off only to find out they didn't pack all of the pieces (bolts) needed. Back it goes - another 15 mins of trying to get it back in the box and then the separate shipping box and drag it across multiple rooms for UPS pick up. Very bummed. Going to look for another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Leyden-Mom

customer_reviews.title: Would Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I've had this installed for over 3 months now and with the added pads from the same company(sold separately) the fit is great. Nice and strong. The latching mechanism is a 2 part. Must push back button and lift on the gate at the same time. I feel confident when opening &closing the gate since its nice and strong/durable. I would give it 5 stars if the pads were part of the gate & not sold separately. I use this to keep my 6 dogs from getting to the upstairs loft.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this gate to keep one of our dogs in particular out of our bedroom & to keep the cat safe for when we have visiting dogs. It is sturdy and well-made and we like that it fits between the door jambs of our double-doors (no hardware involved in installation & can be removed easily if necessary.) The latch & lift style of opening the gate can be a bit of a pain if carrying something but it gets easier with practice. It looks good, too. Overall, we're quite pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: T. L. Borden

customer_reviews.title: Repurchase
customer_reviews.text: After 2 years it broke, Clip came off as I was walking by, my pajama pants got stuck on it and pulled Clip off. But purchased same one because no other gate is as good as this one. Sturdy so doesn’t fall like others when pressure mounted , looks prettier, door stays prop open. Takes less time to break then the 2 other brands I’ve had.
customer_reviews.author: green.13a

customer_reviews.title: sturdy
customer_reviews.text: To open you pull back on a lever and lift up. Not always easy but it works to keep the dogs out of my bedroom. I have one that can jump over my other gate. This one, being curved, has kept him from going over...plus it's taller. It looks nice, too. Doesn't stand out as much as a white one.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Leader

customer_reviews.title: It's well built and a nice looking design
customer_reviews.text: This gate is relatively simple to install. It's design and installation is similar to other safety gates. I use it for my dogs, but it would hold back small children equally as well I suppose and a toddler would not easily be able to open the latch mechanism, which is spring-loaded, pulls up to open, and is stiff enough to resist an attempt to. The extension panels fit very well and the unit has got good weight and has adequate strength & rigidity. Please note 48in wide is the maximum width it will fit. It's worth the cost and I assume it will give many years of use. It's also easy to uninstall.
customer_reviews.author: BarrioB

customer_reviews.title: Can't get it to close all the way
customer_reviews.text: No matter how hard I try (yes, according to the directions) this gate won't latch. I have to secure it with a bungee cord to keep dogs from pushing through. Very sturdy, great quality, will last forever....but, a little difficult to install (not a one person job) and it doesn't get 5 stars because of the latching issue
customer_reviews.author: JackiSnider

customer_reviews.title: Unstable and unsafe
customer_reviews.text: I have spent hours wrestling with this gate to no avail. The opening I have to gate off requires both of the extender pieces, which buckle repeatedly until you get the screws tightened. Then, they still buckle, pop the bolts which scratch your walls and you have to start over. Yesterday I found the gate laying on its side at the top of the stairs and my dog running around wild. This might work if you don't need the extension pieces, but otherwise avoid a huge headache and having to wash your mouth out with soap after dealing with this gate.
customer_reviews.author: CBritton

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy, flexible sizing, not bronze
customer_reviews.text: Just what we needed to keep our dogs from going upstairs. Product provides several extension to get a great sizing. They attach very securely, and they don't have any gaps like some products. The gate latch can be tricky with one hand. Some people asked about the openings and pets. Our cats can definitely jump over it. Our pups are small (12lbs) cannot go over or through, which is exactly our purpose. Only disappointment is the color. It's not really bronze. It's more of a gray-brown. Takes some getting used to. But the gate is serving its purpose so well, I cannot fault it.
customer_reviews.author: Penny B.

customer_reviews.title: Use it Outdoors if You Repaint It
customer_reviews.text: I needed it for outside, but after the first rain I saw signs of rust so I realized that I had to tape and repaint it with the "trigger spray" Rustoleum Paint and Primer-in-one (Buy 2 cans). I chose Hammered Black. The gate works to keep my toddler on the porch so I can leave the gate open, plus it looks nice. It always stays outside. Cons: Although it is self-closing, everyone must always check to make sure the gate is fully closed before the baby goes on the porch. If the angle of the gate isn't right or tightly screwed, it could prevent full closure. I did not yet install the wall holders that would probably fix that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. B

customer_reviews.title: Not getting another one
customer_reviews.text: It came in a brown box which looked fine until I got the gate box out of that box... Obviously someone beat the crap out of the box. I'm not sure if this was used or not but it looks like it. I didn't pay for a used item, I paid for something new. The gate has a few scratches on it but they aren't terrible. I'm just more upset they gave me a beat up seemed to be used package. The extension parts also seem a little cheap but we don't have a toddler that is going to shake the gate so this will work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, attractive and secure
customer_reviews.text: It is an excellent gate and could be used to block even a bigger dog or a small cat from areas of the house you don’t want them in, which was my reason for buying it. It is also very attractive and was fairly easy to install (it is quite heavy!). The self-closing feature is nice and the opening process is difficult enough to keep even a determined child from getting through. If using on the head of a stairway, I’d definitely use the permanent installation pieces to give you peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Deni

customer_reviews.title: Really nice gate and reasonably priced!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good gate— and, since I have dogs that I keep out of several rooms, I have several with some waayyy more expensive than this one. It was pretty easy to get in place, though it took a minute to figure out how to get it aligned so that the lock works. It is really sturdy, closes on its own and—and I like this—unobtrusive. It is pretty but not so big that the gate is all you see. The latch is about waist high on me, so it is easy to use. I am really happy with it. I did not use it on stairs, just between rooms.
customer_reviews.author: C. Medine

customer_reviews.title: Best baby / dog gate ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best doggie gate ever! I was hesitant about it leaving indents in the drywall so I also ordered the nanny pads! Great investment. My dog won’t try to jump over it now because it has the arched top. He’s been giving me the stink eye all week, but he’s not getting into the wife’s living room any more! Loved it so much I bought another one!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Cox

customer_reviews.title: Good gate, door width kind of small
customer_reviews.text: We just got this gate, and so far it works just fine. Installation was easy, and it holds sturdy without any of the extension pieces. My only complaint right now with this gate, is the width of the door to it. If you're plus size and/or pregnant, you'll probably have to walk at an angle to get through. I've seen some people say the width also made it difficult to walk through carrying laundry or groceries...I haven't had this issue, but I'm also on the taller side. Overall, good gate, just wish the door was a little bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Stops a persistent 18mo in her tracks
customer_reviews.text: Needed something to keep our 18mo grand daughter out of the room where the open basement stairs are. This gateworks great and looks good too. Very sturdy. We had our son assemble it, so I don't know if it is easy to assemble, but it didn't take him long. Since it looks nice, we just leave it up all the time, but it would be easy keep it somewhere else and slide it into place and tighten it only when needed if that was what we wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Amy G.

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS THE WALL YOU NEED TO KEEP THEM OUT
customer_reviews.text: i have a chihuahua that keeps coming in the room when he is not supposed no matter how many times i kick him out he keeps coming back now with this fence it is like a tall beautiful wall to keep this little monster out of where he doesn’t belong it is solid as a rock it won’t wobble it extends 4 feet and since i put this up he has stayed out where he is not wanted thank god for this fence and the best part of this amazon paid for it
customer_reviews.author: NAT  M.

customer_reviews.title: It is not 36” tall
customer_reviews.text: The frame of the gate is just under 34”. That missing 2+ inches may not seem like a big deal, but when you have banister railing, you need that height in order for the gate to be below the first step. I had to return the item because we needed the full 36” in order to not trip on the base going up the stairs. The 36” is including the decorative bump. Outside of that, the color is nice, the gate is heavy, the extensions are nice to give it a sturdy hold.
customer_reviews.author: Tracie Bell

customer_reviews.title: Go ahead and get it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this gate to keep my frenchie from bolting out of our house and down our stairs and to keep my bull mastiff from clawing my new door down when he jumps on it, the slats are small enough my puppy can’t get through and the gate is study enough a 165lb bullmastiff can’t knock it down! I’m a happy dog mom
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect outside if you spray with Rust Oleum!
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase. I am using it outside on my deck. It gets LOTS of rain exposure. But I purchased a Rust Oleum Primer and a Rust Oleum Hammered Metal Finish Spray and let loose those entire cans on this sucker. Primer first, then Finish. Once both the cans were empty and I had sufficiently coated every possible inch of the gate, I set it up. That was in August 2015. Haven't seen any rust on it since then! I will probably touch it up this summer with more Rust Oleum, just to be sure, but there hasn't been a single issue with this gate. Works perfectly to keep my rowdy dog from bolting out into the street!
customer_reviews.author: Shadowwolf

customer_reviews.title: Does not latch properly
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these gates. One for the top of the stairs and one for the bottom of the stairs. Neither one latches properly at the bottom. They are tall enough that my child cannot climb over and they look great. I ended up ordering a third gate thinking I have defective gates and still the same problem. When you close the gate it latches at the top however, at the bottom where it should latch I have to force close it with my foot every time to secure it.
customer_reviews.author: maxdmia

customer_reviews.title: Best pet gate I’ve found. And a great value.
customer_reviews.text: This gat is large enough to fit the extra wide entrance to my kitchen. It slows me to keep my dog and her friends out of the kitchen when I’m cooking. It’s easy to relocate to another doorway to keep my dog in the den one a concrete floor with tradings pad stations when I have to be gone for hours. The arched gate looks great in my arched doorways, stays put, and my arthritic hands open it easily. I added wall protection cups for installation.
customer_reviews.author: SLR

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy unless you will be installing it within 90 days!!!
customer_reviews.text: Product is defective out of the box! After installing the gate, I unlocked the door and swung it open, it completely detached from the bottom hinge. There are multiple reviews with the same issue, Summer Infant is clearly selling defective gate since it is not a one time occurrence. They will not issue a refund or replace the gate due to it being outside the 90 day purchase period. I will be filing a Consumer Complaint about this issue.
customer_reviews.author: rmats808

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gate for Big Dogs & Children!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I spent months looking for a dog/baby gate for our kitchen entrance.We tried several options, but nothing was sturdy enough or HIGH enough to contain our two Labradors. Also, nothing seemed aesthetically pleasing.This gate is our perfect solution! It's absolutely beautiful; it's also tall and STURDY. Once you fix this gate into place, it isn't going anywhere. A kitchen is a very busy area. My husband and I have no problem maneuvering in and out with one hand on the latch. You can see the top of the gate in the bottom frame of the photograph.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Outlaw

customer_reviews.title: Baby/Puppy gates work great & look nice❣️
customer_reviews.text: We bought two gates to keep new puppy out of the carpeted area in our house while potty training. These gates were easy to install, very sturdy and look great in our home. I love the swing open ability & they can also stay open if needed. They are heavy duty so care should be given when they swing close that no one is in the way. I would highly recommend them. We will probably leave them up even after puppy training because they look great!
customer_reviews.author: P. Goossens

customer_reviews.title: Nice gate, but wobbly
customer_reviews.text: The gate does the job and keeps what you want on one side. If you attach two of the extra pieces to one side the gate gives slightly when weight is pushed against it or when the door slaps shut. This was bought to keep our corgi from getting into rooms he doesn't belong. He very pushy. The pieces started to bend at the joints, but a family member was able to permanently join them with some hardware from the store. The gate is beautiful and we wanted to keep it. The door works great and swings back every time. We do have to make sure it shuts, but I think that's due to our sneaky dog. :)
customer_reviews.author: Seabas

customer_reviews.title: Has held up for seven years & through 5 kids!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t often take the time to write a review but I was thinking about the gates and how much I appreciate them and realized I should probably let everyone know these guys are awesome! They have held up through the five children We had in five years we bought them seven years ago and they are holding strong. They have been swung on stepped on and just generally abused, and here they are hanging on, and they look great still!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica B.

customer_reviews.title: Solid gate, aesthetically pleasing
customer_reviews.text: Screw mounted between the top railing posts at top of wooden stairs without problem. You must make accurate measurements prior to drilling. Instructions provided are good. You will need a drill and screwdriver if you intend to mount on stairs otherwise instructions state screws aren’t necessary elsewhere. Gate lock and door is easy to use and it takes a good beating from kids slamming the door frequently so it appears durable. Aesthetically pleasing. This works perfect keeping the dogs out.
customer_reviews.author: 0rangeBones

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 dogs. One of which is a high strung trouble maker. When I leave he needs to be locked up or all hell breaks lose. I also have a very naughty persistent 1 year old that needs to be contained. A dog kennel will not work for any of my babies. Human or furbabies. 😆 these gates are exactly what I was looking for. Sturdy and they look good. You can either pressure mount them or screw them in. I highly recommend these gates.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Great gate for a baby but not for a determined cat.
customer_reviews.text: Our 9+lb cat who is quite meaty stuffed herself through the bars near the hinge. This gate is SO CLOSE to perfect as she is somehow too lazy to hop over like our more agile cat (with much better bladder control) but will turn into a liquid when necessary. I bought this based on the reviews saying cats could not fit through but alas, nothing can keep our soot sprite down. Really bummed at yet another failure but it is not the gates fault. Super easy to install and very sturdy compared to our last attempt. At least it will be useful when the baby starts walking...
customer_reviews.author: Rhi

customer_reviews.title: Great product, small complaint.
customer_reviews.text: Instead of the retention holders going 180 degrees like the larger product, this gate you have to align all 4 by dropping them into place on a small ridge on the end supports. This made getting them all into position by yourself actually quite tedious. But actually assembling it was a breeze just wish they had a better method for getting it aligned into the holding pieces that attach to the wall. Now the door holding itself open is a huge plus. And the fact that a tension style gate is this sturdy is also a plus. It has great features and is well built.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible gate, tension is impossible to get correct
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because of how high it says it is. Turns out, it's measuring the middle of the gate, NOT where the gate actually attaches to the wall. Pointless for me, because now there's still a two inch gap under the gate. Set it up anyways. If the tension is tight enough to hold the gate steady and not fall right over anytime the baby is touching it, then even grown adults struggle to open it with two hands. If you lessen the tension so you can get through the gate, the gate falls down when the baby stands at it.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Bear Bethay

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to babyproof our staircase (both top and bottom). Its good in that the doors are hard for babies/toddlers to open (requires pull and lift). It is sturdy and easy to install. Minus one star because you have to check that the gate continues to line up well (If it doesn’t, the door easily pops open which can be unsafe). But it’s a easy thing to fix, as you just need to tighten the edge again- Something to be aware of and on the watch out for.
customer_reviews.author: AL

customer_reviews.title: Locking Mechanism Flimsy and Breaks Easily
customer_reviews.text: From the beginning it ha problems. A week in, it stopped locking tightly and was shaky, but still usable. Then a few short months in my 4 year old daughter (yes, 4!) pushed the gate and the black plastic piece that keeps the gate from opening towards the stairs snapped off. Now the gate is completely unsafe. That piece should have been metal not plastic as without it the gate goes from 5 stars to zero. Very unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: EA

customer_reviews.title: Well built gate
customer_reviews.text: I already have one of these so when a different gate I also had, broke, I ordered Summer Multi-Use Deco Extra Tall Walk-Thru Gate. They are great gates. It has a new feature that my older one does not have. A retainer that when you open the gate and want to leave it open it stays open. When I first installed it I thought the door was broken but just a little force and it moves and the stop holds it open if you want. Highly recommend this gate.
customer_reviews.author: David W Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: If you need a strong safety gate, look no further...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Powder coated metal. Very sturdy. Very easy to install. Surpassed my expectations. I did order different bumpers that were thicker and rubbery, that would not hurt the wall upon installation. Very strong. very nice. very worth the money. :) they did a nice job on this. Helps with boundaries for our strong, bouncy, wild, 2 year old pitbull. :0) totally worth the price, attend color matches home decor well.
customer_reviews.author: Kelso

customer_reviews.title: Nice Gate
customer_reviews.text: Nice piece - good quality, though the door may be a bit out of alignment, because the bottom doesn't latch automatically when I release the door. The top latches fine, and it's not going to open (particularly with the swing-bracket preventing it from opening outward), but if I want the bottom to latch, I need to bend down and push it into place. I made sure the gate is straight, but the bottom of the door is off a fraction of an inch. Other than that, it's easy to install, sturdy, looks good, and works well.
customer_reviews.author: pinmagic

customer_reviews.title: Good gate, great aesthetic.
customer_reviews.text: This is, by far, the prettiest gate at this price point. We have used cheap plastic, plain ugly wood, and finally found this metal one and it is just perfect. The gate is easy and convenient to use, no more stepping over. The latch is secure. No damage to door frame. A+. Its like a puzzle, but by now I think we are all used to building little furniture pieces here and there. It's easy, not like building something enormous with many parts. Maybe a 30 minute set-up.
customer_reviews.author: Annah

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly and works perfectly. Installation was easy, since I've had these gates before I knew just how to put it together. You can mount it by tension, which I do, or screw it into your walls if you prefer. The gate, after opening so far, will stay open by itself, which is a nice improvement from the old models, which when you swing those open there was nothing to keep them open so you had to attach a little bungie cord or something to hold it open. I like this gate, it looks nice and works well, and I'd recommend it to anyone wanting to keep their dogs out of a particular room from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: AReview4U

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good deal!
customer_reviews.text: So they should have better/easier to understand instructions, but we were able to figure it out after a little bit. We didn’t use the screws to hold it in place, but the device itself is pretty sturdy as long as you don’t lean on it or put any pressure on the top of the gate. We bought it for our dog, but now the dog jumps over it. -_- It’ll work just fine for kids, we have one on the way so it’ll definitely come in handy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this gate
customer_reviews.text: I love this gate! I purchased this to go in the hallway to keep the dogs in the bedroom, and I didn’t want to struggle setting up and taking down a tradintional style gate. This gate is very sturdy ( even without mounting it to the wall) and has a good solid feel. The instructions were clear and it only took me about 10 minutes from unboxing to complete set up. My favorite part about the gate is that it will stay in an open ‘locked’ position if I push it open far enough, but if I just walk through it, it will close behind me. Considering a second one for another area in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Erika Deaton

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good gate.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a pretty good gate. Pros: I love the look of it. It's a much more appealing than most of the other gates I found. Easy installation. Easy to use (open and close the door). Cons: We use this gate to keep our dogs in the back of our house and if they knock into the gate, it actually moves the lower portion of the gate out of its spot (the portion that is screwed into the wall), so I frequently have to fix it. It also doesn't always stay straight, and then the door will stay open since there's space between the door gate.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Great gate!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this baby gate. We had tried a few other brands and were unhappy with the sturdiness of them. This one is quality metal that looks very nice, has a secure locking mechanism that you must lift up slightly to open, and will swing shut on its own. Ours is mounted at the top of the stairs and functions perfectly. We ordered a “like new, open box” one from amazon warehouse. It came with everything needed to mount it. It did not have any indications that it had been previously used or manhandled in any way during shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Rachu

customer_reviews.title: The ideal gate for the s
customer_reviews.text: I love this baby gate. It is at the top of the stairs and the height makes it hard for my daughter to even reach the top. It has a double security measure; you have to slide the release level and lift the gate up at the same time, so she cannot even try to open it. She also can't climb up the vertical bars. The only thing to be aware of is the automatic close function. Sometimes, the pull is so hard it closes, but bounces out of place. Once it did that and my daughter opened it, and it scared the heck out of me. Just double check that it latches when you walk through it.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: This is the best thing we have ever ordered from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this gate to keep our new dog out the living room and dining room... We wanted something that was pretty and was easy to install.. and that made it easy for us to maneuver between rooms .. This gate has answered all our wants. It is very attractive... it was easy to install ... easy to open.... closes automatically,,, what more can I say about this wonderful addition to our home... IT IS THE ANSWER TO ALL THE AWFUL GATES IN THE PAST... It look beautiful !
customer_reviews.author: Atlanta1776

customer_reviews.title: Decorative, work well.
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 of these in our home...one to keep our dogs from going downstairs and one to contain our bulldog in a foyer area when we are at work. They are very decorative as compared to most pet gates and are made of metal (not plastic). The gates require occasional tightening/readjustment, otherwise are quite sturdy. However, if you have a large dog that jumps, they might be able to dislodge the gate from the wall. They work very well for our intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Don F.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Worked well used it outside (Wisconsin) all year long, have to very large security dogs (Rotties) no young children. So I cant state how it worked for children but I purposely used it for our dogs they cant open it (very smart dogs) do to the automatic close and locking of the door. Works every time without fail during all weather situations price was good the material was good (not cheap looking) it took a little while to get it to fit the wrap around fencing (wood) open area that we wanted to close off for the dogs (unless we wanted them in that area) but with time and patience it fits and has not lost its tension would recommend
customer_reviews.author: zena

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and sturdy and nice latch dust
customer_reviews.text: Nice sturdy and well built. Very nice gates. Always skeptical about putting at stairs. Would depend on size of child and how hard and how much they would press on gate. Really like the latch and if you open all way it will stop and stay open. This is handy when going into other area for second to grab something or once child in bed so you don’t have to constantly open. Would recommend some of the Wall Nanny or similar products to use with it. Also very nice that it is available in a color other than white. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great barrier for our 3 terriers
customer_reviews.text: We are using this as a barrier to the main closet accessed through our bathroom. I wanted to take the door off for better access to the interior but needed something to keep the dogs out but allow easy access for us humans. I also needed something taller than average as one of the pups can jump high. This has worked exactly as we needed it too. The gate is easy to use. It is very sturdy and does not slip once placed. The color goes well with our bronze fixtures. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cosby

customer_reviews.title: Best I've found
customer_reviews.text: Super sturdy and pretty easy to install. Only issue was the pegs used for integrating the optional extenders can be a challenge to remove; also adjusting the swing of the door is time-consuming and not especially straight forward (it can be done though). I've owned three of these and the self-closing mechanism broke on one after about a year. Other than that, these have been awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Erin1982

customer_reviews.title: All it took was one kick...
customer_reviews.text: I really liked using this gate on my patio to keep my dog from running right off. It looks like a really nice quality gate. I didn’t like how hard it was to tighten the gate into place as I was having to retighten it often. Unfortunately, all it took was one drunken friend to kick it for it to be unusable. He probably had a strong kick but it bent the metal more than I thought possible. Great while it lasted though!
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality Walk-Thru Gate
customer_reviews.text: We wanted to keep our dog from walking into the kitchen as we are cooking and this gate has been the best purchase of 2019 for us. We love it. Excellent Sturdy quality - Very Easy to Set up. At first you will think something is wrong with the gate as it look bent, no, this is part of the pressure it need to lock tight when you mount it. Read the instruction.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Love the look and that it helps with my two big dogs. I installed mine at the top of the stairs. I would say it will probably take about 20-45 mins depending on where and how you're installing it. Overall it looks good and has withstood a 95lb dog jumping up on it once or twice and has held like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Solid and nice height
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice and tall heavy metal gait, with 3 extension pieces that allow for different width sizes to be done. I am using it for my Goldendoodle to allow him to be in the utility room when alone instead of a crate and it will work nicely between the two walls. The only issue is that the lock on the gate is somewhat simple and it is very easy for the door to be opened, but it is not a big problem for me to put a little tie on it to keep it closed. I’m very pleased overall and I thank you very much.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Frequentl use and extension =4 months of use :-(
customer_reviews.text: Out lock broke within a month, my dog leaned in and it just broke. Two mo th after we purchased it the extension started to wobble and fail. This fate is installed professionally and is on our kitchen to living room door so it gets used a lot. Now it’s failed 4 month after we bought it. Again, I think extensions make the construction fail since we have non extended gate on kitchen to den doorway and it fared better.
customer_reviews.author: Yuliya

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy  and  looks great !!!
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to dislike about this.works as it should.its so handy to have a gate with a door you can easily walk thru vs having to step over it or take the whole thing up every time you need to get to the other side.its big enough to fit our hallway so I can keep it closed when we need to confine pets to either side of house.also keep the door open when confinement not needed.easy to assemble too.
customer_reviews.author: dorothy w.

customer_reviews.title: Keeping the cats inside
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to keep cats from sneaking out when someone comes to the front door or when we stepped outside to get the Sunday paper. It was installed between the inside and outer door. It works great and fits nicely. It allows us or our visitors to still enter and leave. The gate is also attractive. But it was not an easy install. My son is quite experienced in these kinds of projects and it took him 2 hours. But it was worth it. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and not an eyesore like most gates
customer_reviews.text: This is the third time I have bought one of these gates. Not because the other two stopped working, just converted a room and wanted to keep the dogs out of it. So I needed another one. These gates are very easy to install. Takes less than 2 minutes. The first two I bought 5+ years ago are still in everyday use and show no wear and tear. The one I received today has some upgrades over the last one. The gate can keep itself open if opened to its lock point. The older ones would swing closed if you were not holding them. I like this feature, especially since I am using it to block off my laundry room.
customer_reviews.author: J. Glidden

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Love!
customer_reviews.text: We have a Husky/Terrier Mix whom we should have named Houdini. She is always getting into trouble. We try to lock her in certain areas, but she always gets out. We put up some previous white plastic gates we had from another puppy but they are a pain to open and don't really hold her. I ordered one of these to check it out, and it is great! I am not very good at putting even simple things together, and I was able to get this up by myself. It keeps her out of the room, and I can easily open the gate to get in and out. I am going to order 2 more.
customer_reviews.author: Irma M.

customer_reviews.title: Defective manufacturing
customer_reviews.text: This gate is useless. The quality control is so bad, neither the bottom catch nor the top lock works. The gap between the gate and the top lock is so wide it cannot possibly work. It was a total waste of money. Unfortunately, we didn't need it at the moment it was delivered and did not realize the defect until it was too late to return the thing. Our fault, but the whole experience has been disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Ferg's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Very solid gate
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy gate, reasonably easy to install. However I gave it four stars because it's fairly noisy to open and close, not ideal for a nursery gate. We have it down the hall so it's not an issue, but worth noting. Also you really need two hands or a very strong one hand without a wiggling Baby in the other to open it. But definitely toddler proof I reckon and great for babies and pets. Our cats are deterred by it too.
customer_reviews.author: fmf

customer_reviews.title: Better than Regalo
customer_reviews.text: I googled "best baby gate for dogs" and ordered the gate recommended: Regalo Easy Step Extra Tall Walk Thru Baby Gate <--- What a piece of junk that was! We returned it the same day and ordered this gate. We've actually had this gate in another home for over a year and love it. It is simple to install, adjusts easily and is very sturdy, heavy, well-made. The nanny wall protectors are nice too, but we don't have them with the gate on the other house. (They are not necessary.)
customer_reviews.author: TRH

customer_reviews.title: Doorways between 36.1-36.4 this gate won’t work
customer_reviews.text: The width range on the description is misleading. This is a nice, heavy gate that looks great and is easy to operate. However, our doorway is 36.2 inches and there isn’t a configuration using the extensions for doorway widths between 36.1-36.4 inches. At the 36 inch width configuration, the gate wasn’t stabilizing and kept moving slightly on the doorframe. I tried adding the other smaller extension but it didn’t fit in the doorway after that. So if you need a gate for width between 36.1-36.4 I do not recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Garnet Diamond

customer_reviews.title: too SMALL to pass through
customer_reviews.text: the actual product is well built and steardy, i installed it in minutes, was kinda proud of my self for putting it together and installing it. then the family started walking through it and complaining. you see, the problem is that the passage way (the door) the part you walk through IS ONLY 17.5" WIDE! you almost have to walk throught it sideways. i retured the product and purchaced some non name brand that has a 24" door.
customer_reviews.author: tomerleh

product_meta.title: Summer Multi-Use Decorative Extra Tall Walk-Thru Baby Gate, Metal, Bronze Finish – 36” Tall, Fits Openings up to 28.5” to 48” Wide, Baby and Pet Gate for Doorways and Stairways
product_meta.description: Color:Bronze| Size:28.5 - 48 InchChild proof your home in style with the Summer Multi-Use Decorative Extra Tall Walk-Thru Baby Gate. Along with the bronze metal finish, this baby gate will complement any home décor. Have some peace of mind knowing that this sleek gate accommodates both doorway and stairway installation. Easily install this baby gate on stairways with the included kit, or by using the no drill doorway mount for in-between doorways. Tools are required for hardware mounting. This 36” tall baby gate fits openings up to 28.5” to 48” wide making it the ideal gate for toddlers and small pets.
feature_bullets: ACCOMODATES MOST OPENINGS: The Summer Multi-Use Decorative Extra Tall Walk-Thru Gate for Baby can be used between doorways and stairways. The 36” tall baby gate fits openings up 28.5” to 48” wide.
EASY INSTALLATION: Easily install this baby gate on stairways with the included kit, or by using the no drill doorway mount for in-between doorways. Tools are required for hardware mounting.
AUTO-CLOSE FEATURE: For added hands-free convenience, this safety gate is equipped with an auto-close feature that gently closes the door behind you and a hold-open feature that keeps the door open.

SAFE AND SECURE: Have peace of mind knowing your baby or pet can explore safely with Summer’s Multi-Use Decorative Extra Tall Walk-Thru baby gate. Plus, the removable door stopper prevents the door from swinging open oven the stairs.
STYLISH BABY GATE: This extra tall baby gate is metal with a bronze finish, so you can child proof your home in style. Standing 36” tall, it is ideal for use with toddlers and small pets.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars12,303 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
